body.name: HP P500 Portable SSD 1TB - USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type C, USB- External Solid State Hard Drive - Up to 420MB/s, Black - 1F5P4AA#ABC
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 20 hrs 48 mins
features: TRANSFER IN A FLASH: Transfer massive files within seconds with the incredible speed of USB 3.2 Gen 1. HP P500 delivers read and write speeds of up to 420 MB/s, saving time on loading videos, photos, and games.

UP TO 1 TB CAPACITY: With up to 1 TB capacity, massive photo libraries, files, games, and movie collections can now all fit in your pocket. At less than 50 grams, the HP P500 takes your digital world anywhere.
SLEEK AND COMPACT STYLE: Weighing only about 45.4 grams, the P500 fits comfortably in your pocket and is light enough to take your files whereever you go.

BUILT FOR STRENGTH AND SECURITY: The HP P500 has no moving parts so it's more resistant to shock. Its solid aluminum alloy body adds further protection, keeping your data secure from falls—and private.

CABLES INCLUDED FOR MULTI-DEVICE COMPATIBILITY：Comes with USB Type C-to-A cable and Type A-to-C adaptor, the HP P500 supports new-gen USB 3.2 Gen 1 interface and is compatible with PC, Mac, Android devices, gaming consoles, and more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Could not use
reviews.reviewText: I put songs on this drive and it wouldn't let me keep it open. So I had to return it. I think it was defective!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars cheap and Best
reviews.reviewText: This product transfers the files at max speed and also compact enough and come along with c port to usb port cable to transfer from mac and also windows systems..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars It's TRASH. Not dependable, then you're stuck with NO SUPPORT
reviews.reviewText: This NEW HP Portable SSD P500 (1TB) Hard Drive is pure TRASH. Considering that this is where one stores all one's important files and irreplaceable photos, IT NEEDS TO BE DEPENDABLE. It isn't. When I got it, it worked just fine. It is plug n play, so simply connected it to the HP laptop and started to transfer ALL our photos and important documents, for safekeeping. On the second day of transferring our files to it, ALL OF A SUDDEN it just stopped working and it disappeared from view on our laptop, so we could no longer access ANY of our files and photos... NOTHING. For all effect it was as if it was not even there. Other devices connected to the same USB-C connection just fine. Tried it on another laptop and same result... NOTHING there. Tried the USB-C to USB-C cord on another device and it worked just fine. Just this HP Portable SSD P500 hard drive is the problem, ceasing to work/be read by the second day of use.Called Amazon Tech Support (Shawneil). He said that there was NO WARRANTY because it was bought thru a non HP seller, even though the sale was from "The HP Store"... go figure that one out. He tried to solution it directly but couldn't. So he called HP Tech Support, which gave us the run around for 56 mins. He acknowledged our frustration with HP Tech Support and managed to just give me a refund of $59.99 of the $64.99 that I paid for it, plus tax. Well, something is better than nothing, since I CANNOT RETURN the product because it has all my files and photos LOCKED and UNACCESSIBLE within it.Just the same, I will never buy another HP product again, it they are now building such CR*P.However, I have to acknowledge the Amazon Tech Support representative, Shawneil, for excellent Customer Service. His efforts and understanding of my frustrations with this product, went a long way to make my grievance less stressful. Thank you Shawneil.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New HP SSD drive.
reviews.reviewText: Worked as needed. Transfered lots of pic and files. Made folders. Works like a charm so far. Keep you updated.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars HP SSD External Hard Drive: A Fast and Portable Storage Solution
reviews.reviewText: I bought the HP SSD external hard drive to store and transfer my files, and I am very happy with it. This device is fast, reliable, and easy to use with both Windows and Mac laptops.The HP SSD external hard drive is very light and compact, making it easy to carry around. It connects via USB-C or USB-A ports, and it supports USB 3.2 Gen 2 speeds, which are very good. I have the 1 TB model, which has plenty of space for all my documents, photos, videos, and programs. I can also use it as a bootable drive or run programs directly from it.Overall, the HP SSD external hard drive is a great choice for anyone who needs a fast and portable storage solution. It is compatible with both Windows and Mac laptops, and it offers a good balance of speed, capacity, and durability. It is also reasonably priced, especially for the 1 TB model. If you are looking for an external SSD that can handle your everyday needs, you should definitely consider the HP SSD external hard drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Small portable size with big results
reviews.reviewText: The 500gb solid state drive fits in the palm of your hand and absolutely worked fantastic with my new 2023 MacBook Air. The files transferred so quick and so easily. The reason for the four star review is the USB-c connection and adapter that came with the drive would not work on my new macbook but I had a two-sided USB-C cable that worked perfectly. I highly recommend this drive and especially for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well on Mac OS! Worth the money
reviews.reviewText: I’ve successfully connected this SSD with my MacBook, and it even works with Time Machine for data backups! No more having to pay monthly for expanded iCloud storage that could get lost if the subscription is canceled

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Recently replaced my old HP laptop with a brand new HP laptop. I needed a large external hard drive to transfer all my files and 15 years of photos to the new computer. I plug this in to the old laptop and all files transferred flawlessly. I then plug this in to my new laptop, and again all files transferred to the new laptop without a single problem. This HP Hard Drive works perfect and I would highly recommend it for anyone with an HP computer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst HP SSD, dont waste money, time and patience.
reviews.reviewText: HP has fallen down heavily on the quality of this SSD as it stopped working the very next day. I should have never bought this drive to start with. Backed up my whole computer data and recycled the laptop. Now the HP SSD has nothing but errors, I have lost all my Data. Worst experience ever. Never going to buy any HP product ever. I dont know why Amazon is still selling this extremely low quality product for $125, this is now like a paper weight.
